description: Postmark helps deliver and track transactional emails for web applications. In a nutshell, the service replaces SMTP (or Sendmail) with a far more reliable, scalable and care-free environment. In addition, you can track statistics such as number of emails sent or processed, opens, bounces and spam complaints.
steps: Create an server for a new API credentials https://account.postmarkapp.com/servers
After creation server you will see API credentials in server settings

events.name: webhookEvent
events.description: A webhook is the act of Postmark making an HTTP POST request to your application’s API when an event occurs. This way Postmark is able to immediately notify you when an event occurs and your application doesn’t have to perform complicated polling of Postmark’s API to determine if something new occurred.

payload.Name: Hard bounce
payload.Description: The server was unable to deliver your message (ex: unknown user, mailbox not found).
payload.Subject: Test subject

steps: When logged into Postmark, select the server and go to the `Settings` tab and then the Outbound/Inbound tab. The `Bounce/Inbound Webhook` field is where you should input your webhook URL __WEBHOOK_URL__

You can modify the InboundHookUrl/OutboundHookUrl field using the Servers API to modify existing servers. You can also use the Servers API to create servers and set the InboundHookUrl/OutboundHookUrl field at the same time.See more in readme.

args.name: serverToken
args.info: Your serverToken.

blocks.name: sendEmail
blocks.description: This endpoint is solely responsible for sending emails with Postmark through a specific server.

args.name: serverToken
args.info: This request requires server level privileges. This token can be found on the Credentials tab under your Postmark server.

args.name: from
args.info: The sender email address. Must have a registered and confirmed Sender Signature.

args.name: to
args.info: Recipient email address. Multiple addresses are comma separated. Max 50.

args.name: CcRecipientEmailAddress
args.info: Cc recipient email address. Multiple addresses are comma separated. Max 50.

args.name: BccRecipientEmailAddress
args.info: Bcc recipient email address. Multiple addresses are comma separated. Max 50.

args.name: subject
args.info: Email subject.

args.name: tag
args.info: Email tag that allows you to categorize outgoing emails and get detailed statistics.

args.name: htmlBody
args.info: If no TextBody specified HTML email message.

args.name: textBody
args.info: If no HtmlBody specified Plain text email message.

args.name: textBody
args.info: If no HtmlBody specified Plain text email message.

args.name: replyTo
args.info: Reply To override email address. Defaults to the Reply To set in the sender signature.

args.name: headers

structure.name: Name
structure.info: Custom header name.

structure.name: Value
structure.info: Custom header value.

args.info: List of custom headers to include.

args.name: trackOpens
args.info: Activate open tracking for this email.

args.name: trackLinks
args.info: Activate link tracking for links in the HTML or Text bodies of this email.

args.name: attachments

structure.name: Name
structure.info: File name.

structure.name: Content
structure.info: File url.

structure.name: ContentType
structure.info: contentType of file.

structure.name: ContentID
structure.info: Postmark also allows you to send inline images via HTML mesages. Images must be base64-encoded and the ContentID field must match the image's CID.

args.info: List of attachments

blocks.name: getBounces

args.info: This request requires server level privileges. This token can be found on the Credentials tab under your Postmark server.

args.name: count
args.info: Number of bounces to return per request. Max 500.

args.name: offset
args.info: Number of bounces to skip.

args.name: inactive
args.info: Filter by emails that were deactivated by Postmark due to the bounce. Set to true or false. If this isn’t specified it will return both active and inactive.

args.info: Filter by email address.

args.name: tag

args.name: fromDate
args.info: Filter messages starting from the date specified (inclusive). e.g. 2014-02-01

args.name: toDate
args.info: Filter messages up to the date specified (inclusive). e.g. 2014-02-01

args.info: Bounce types.See more in readme.

args.info: This request requires server level privileges. This token can be found on the Credentials tab under your Postmark server.

args.info: Name of server.

args.info: Color of the server in the rack screen.

args.name: dmtpApiActivated
args.info: Specifies whether or not SMTP is enabled on this server.

args.name: rawEmailEnabled
args.info: Enable raw email to be sent with inbound.

args.name: deliveryHookUrl
args.info: URL to POST to every time email is delivered.

args.name: inboundHookUrl
args.info: URL to POST to every time an inbound event occurs.

args.name: bounceHookUrl
args.info: URL to POST to every time a bounce event occurs.

args.name: includeBounceContentInHook
args.info: Include bounce content in webhook.

args.name: openHookUrl
args.info: URL to POST to every time an open event occurs.

args.name: postFirstOpenOnly
args.info: If set to true, only the first open by a particular recipient will initiate the open webhook. Any subsequent opens of the same email by the same recipient will not initiate the webhook.

args.name: trackOpens
args.info: Indicates if all emails being sent through this server have open tracking enabled.

args.name: trackLinks
args.info: Indicates if all emails being sent through this server should have link tracking enabled for links in their HTML or Text bodies.

args.name: clickHookUrl
args.info: URL to POST to when a unique click event occurs.

args.name: inboundDomain
args.info: Inbound domain for MX setup.

args.name: inboundSpamThreshold
args.info: The maximum spam score for an inbound message before it's blocked.

blocks.name: RotateDKIMKeys
blocks.description: Creates a new DKIM key to replace your current key. Until the new DNS entries are confirmed, the pending values will be in DKIMPendingHost and DKIMPendingTextValue fields. After the new DKIM value is verified in DNS, the pending values will migrate to DKIMTextValue and DKIMPendingTextValue and Postmark will begin to sign emails with the new DKIM key.

args.name: accountToken
args.info: This request requires account level privileges. Only accessible by the account owner, this token can be found on the Account tab of your Postmark account.

args.name: domainId
args.info: Id of the domain.
